WODESC: CHECK AND REPAIR CONCRETE PAD ON 138KV BREAKER 5E
ROCKVIEW - TRF2 DELUGE REPAIRS - VENDOR WORK -
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Take a picture of each one of the bushing nameplates (Bushings 69kV and up).  Once a picture of each nameplate is taken, the picture is to be sent to field equipment engineering to analyze and validate.   Equipment engineering will verify type of bushing and asset management to upload nameplate data into the MTL if information is not already in place. The information will then be gathered and retained in the MTL for Con Edison records.
WORK_STEPS: Have job briefing and discuss HPI tools  Set up ladder and maintain clearance from all energized equipment  Take a photo of each bushing nameplate and record bushing information for bushings 69kV and above. The photo must show the manufacturer and catalogue/model number and serial number of the bushing. Also record the information.  Upload photos for review and send to the following for validation  dl-maximoadmins@coned.com  SEField&Equipment@coned.com BRYANS@coned.com
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Ladder Ladder Belt Camera

NERC ADVISORY INSPECTION FOR HVB BREAKERS
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform NERC Maintenance Advisory on HVB362 345KV SF6 breaker  Perform leak check of breaker after inspection Perform a major dt after inspection (separate work order #) Complete datasplice Rounds for both NERC Advisory Inspections and Major DT Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform NERC Maintenance Advisory on HVB362 345KV SF6 breaker as per provided attachments Take initial SF6 Gas Pressures for all phases Ensure Chem Lab test breaker for SO prior to gas removal Remove SF6 Gas from breaker Open breaker a perform an assessment of initial conditions Replace nozzle  Re-Torque Nozzle Bolting Take stroke and wipe measurement Replace o-rings Replace desiccants, Desiccant Kit Required Pull vacuum on breaker Refill breaker with SF6 Ensure Chem Lab performs a Post-Inspection SF6 Testing, including leak check Submit the HVB Advisory Report  Complete datasplice round, create cm work order for any discrepancies that were not addressed Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Assorted metric wrenches & sockets  Static grounds Appropriate PPE (face shield, goggles, gloves, etc.) Spring removal tool  Master gauge  Air Pressure Gauge SF6 gas camera  SF6 gas sniffer  Leak tech Air Tanker, tripod, hose Ladders Air Monitoring Equipment Required
MATERIALS: NERC advisory kit Desiccant Kit tarps rope barrier tape duct tape black electrical tape garbage bags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: 3.0 PRECAUTIONS 3.1 Review and “Walk down” protection with Station Operator prior to obtaining work permit. 3.2 If there is live equipment in the proximity of the work area, provide barriers to indicate high voltage area. 3.3 Wear all appropriate personal protection. 3.4 All interrupter mechanisms SHALL be operated in a controlled manner. 3.5 Do not manually operate an energized circuit switcher. 3.6 Personnel SHALL keep clear of mechanisms that are to be operated or released.
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE THAT JOB BRIEFING IS HELD ONSITE  ENSURE SAFE DRIVING  COMMUNICATE WITH STATION OPERATOR AND OBTAIN WP as required Recommended HPI Tools: ATTENTION TO DETAIL, Two Minute Rule, & Questioning Attitude {See attached HPI TOOLBOX for guidance}  GO OVER PROTECTION  OBTAIN WORK P0ERMIT FOR SCAFFOLD TO BE ERRECTED ONCE SCAFFOLD IS UP, OBTAIN WORK PERMIT FOR PM INSPECTION START TO CLEAN THE SWITCH AS PER THE PROCEDURE   DAY TWO TAKE ALL READINGS MICRO-OHM TIMING FILL IN THE DATA SHEET IF ALL READINGS ARE GOOD CONTINUE THE INSPECTION DAY THREE OPERATION CHECKS AND SIGN OFF PERMIT REMOVE SCAFFOLD  5.1 As-Found Condition 5.2 Circuit Switcher Overall Resistance. 5.3 Interrupter Contact Timing. 5.4 Contact Timing – Interrupter and Disconnect. 5.5 Repairs and Adjustments. 5.6 Post Maintenance Inspection.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • 1000-volt Meg-ohm meter • Micro-ohm meter (100 amp DC) • Clamp-on meter • Barrier tape • Cleaner/Degreaser • Chain Lubricant • Disconnect Switch contact lubricant – Shell Darina EP2, Dow Corning DC44, or equivalent. • Lift or scaffold • Lint Free Rags • Personal Protective Equipment • Replacement parts as necessary • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • All-In-Lubricant Kit • Stop Watch • Timing set
MATERIALS: GREASE RAGS SCOTCH BRITE

FENCE AND GATE GROUNDING INSPECTION - ONE-TIME
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Objective Inspect all perimeter fence and swing gates -Ensure all are properly connected to ground via 4/0 cable
WORK_STEPS: Review section 5.4.9 in CE-ES-2002 Part 10 Substation Grounding & DRW 181895 for fence grounding specifications Inspect all perimeter fences and gates -All perimeter fences should be connected to ground -All swing gates should be connected  to fence via braided strap -Perform easy repair such as reattaching a ground, tightening a connection point..etc. Note all issues found Complete datasplice round and create cm work orders for any deficiencies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Hand Tools

WORK_OBJECTIVES: ensure to receive a comprehensive job briefing
WORK_STEPS: ensure protection is adequate /  remove broken window on position 32W pothead door install Lexan plexiglass window / drill and secure  use silicone to seal the window from water intrusion
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools / silicone gun & silicone / Eye protection and Kevlar gloves / plexiglass cutter / drill and assorted small bits # 21 up 1/4 inch /
MATERIALS: Lexan plexiglass / 1/4 -20 bolts and hardware or smaller

WODESC: MW - REPLACE DRAIN BLOCKER BAGS IN 138 YARD

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a Minor DT on a  Mitsubishi 120 SFMT circuit breaker Perform a check of initial conditions Observe and record all required SF6 pressures and chemical values Perform a mechanical check of the circuit breaker Perform an inspection of the Oil Filled Shock Absorbers Perform an inspection of the operating linkage Perform a check of the operating mechanism Perform a check of the air compressor system per Instruction 0500-0017 Perform a check of the air system Measure and record all required pressure switch set points and pump up times Perform a check of the SF6 gas system, if required Perform a check of the electrical system Perform all required lubrication steps Perform a cleaning of the circuit breaker Perform and record micro ohm measurement across all three closed interrupters Perform and record timing and velocity test of the circuit breaker If required, perform an insulation resistance test of the circuit breaker Observe and record the “as left” counter reading Perform a final inspection of the circuit breaker Create a CM for all required maintenance
WORK_STEPS: Perform a Minor Breaker DT Follow Instruction 0770-1001, ensure all objectives are all completed A copy of the provisional  0770-1001 is attached, please provide feedback of any corrections or items that may have been missed Datasplice round will be created and added to job plan once instruction is approved
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • Micro-Ohm Meter • Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) • Timing Test Equipment • Non-metallic rule • 300mm straight ruler (Used for slow close) • Wiring tools • Short torque wrench • Binding wire • Barrier tape or equivalent barrier material/equipment • Highly visible nonconductive netting or grating • Assorted wrenches, 1/2 inch drive metric sockets and square drive ratchet • Ladders • Tarps • Rope • Fall prevention and protection equipment • PPE (face shield, goggles, gloves, etc.) • Warning signs (Indicating a high voltage hazard) • SF6 leak detection camera - - FLIR GF306 SF6 GasFind Camera or equivalent • SF6 Gas Sniffer
MATERIALS: • All-In-One Lubrication Kit • Mechanism Control valve Seal, Part No. 3024 and Seat, Part No. 3025 • Air Compressor air intake filter, Part No. 0135-3020. • Mitsubishi Control Valve Rebuild Kit, Part # C100798G01 • Air Compressor Oil: Shell Corena Oil N-46 or equivalent • Shell Darina #2 grease, or Mitsubishi Diamond low temperature grease #2 or equivalent • Lint-free cloth • Rags • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • Oil absorbent pads/pigs • Duct tape • Approved Leak Detection Liquid - - Swagelok Snoop or equivalent
OTHER_GROUPS: PROVISIONAL PENDING REVIEW OF INSTRUCTIONS Chem Lab

WORK_OBJECTIVES: 3.0 PRECAUTIONS 3.1 Review and “Walk down” protection with Station Operator prior to obtaining work permit. 3.2 If there is live equipment in the proximity of the work area, provide barriers to indicate high voltage area. 3.3 Wear all appropriate personal protection. 3.4 All interrupter mechanisms SHALL be operated in a controlled manner. 3.5 Do not manually operate an energized circuit switcher. 3.6 Personnel SHALL keep clear of mechanisms that are to be operated or released.
WORK_STEPS: GO OVER PROTECTION  OBTAIN WORK P0ERMIT FOR SCAFFOLD TO BE ERRECTED ONCE SCAFFOLD IS UP, OBTAIN WORK PERMIT FOR PM INSPECTION START TO CLEAN THE SWITCH AS PER THE PROCEDURE   DAY TWO TAKE ALL READINGS MICRO-OHM TIMING FILL IN THE DATA SHEET IF ALL READINGS ARE GOOD CONTINUE THE INSPECTION DAY THREE OPERATION CHECKS AND SIGN OFF PERMIT REMOVE SCAFFOLD  5.1 As-Found Condition 5.2 Circuit Switcher Overall Resistance. 5.3 Interrupter Contact Timing. 5.4 Contact Timing – Interrupter and Disconnect. 5.5 Repairs and Adjustments. 5.6 Post Maintenance Inspection.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • 1000-volt Meg-ohm meter • Micro-ohm meter (100 amp DC) • Clamp-on meter • Barrier tape • Cleaner/Degreaser • Chain Lubricant • Disconnect Switch contact lubricant – Shell Darina EP2, Dow Corning DC44, or equivalent. • Lift or scaffold • Lint Free Rags • Personal Protective Equipment • Replacement parts as necessary • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • All-In-Lubricant Kit • Stop Watch • Timing set
MATERIALS: GREASE RAGS SCOTCH BRITE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Check if heat Sink is Powder Coated or Bare Inspect side wall and radiator for signs of heat/arcing Measure distance from wall and heat sink (Radiator) Complete datasplice round

WODESC: REPAIR PVILLE B2 LOW GAS TRIP AFTER ENGINEERING REVIEWS
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Investigate B2 Wiring / Not tripping on low gas pressure
WORK_STEPS: Verify that the SF6 Low Pressure Automatic Tripping Relays 63TG1 and 63TG2 and the Oil Low Pressure Automatic Tripping Relays 63X1 and 63X 2 are wired into the tripping circuit. This can be done by verifying that the jumpers between points 53, 54, and 55 are installed on the Breaker Trip Coil T1 circuit and the jumpers between points 56, 57 and 58 are installed on the Breaker Trip Coil T2 circuit. See attached schematic 1987M00649 for reference
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: fluke meter spin tight  wire tags

WODESC: INSTALL LOW DC VOLTAGE SUPPLY ALARM AS PER ESR 2543
INSTALL LOW DC VOLTAGE SUPPLY ALARM AS PER ESR 2543
INSTALL LOW DC VOLTAGE SUPPLY ALARM AS PER ESR 2543
INSTALL LOW DC VOLTAGE SUPPLY ALARM AS PER ESR 2543
INSTALL LOW DC VOLTAGE SUPPLY ALARM AS PER ESR 2543

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform Disconnect PM / Ground Switch PM
WORK_STEPS: Perform operational check and resistance readings across all current carrying parts. utilize jacking bolts on columns to adjust stacks to allow for proper alignment of blade in jaw. blade should be perpendicular to jaw with good compression  after alignment perform operational checks  clean current carrying parts with scotch brite for heavy oxidation use wire wheel apply a thin coat of penetrox to current carrying parts.  PM switch disconnect and ground: Clean all glass insulators. Lubricate all pivot points and gears. Check operation for binding  Examine mechanisms for stress crack + broken pieces (inform supervisor and take pictures if possible) Torque all bolts to spec and check that pins are piercing drive pipes. Verify U-clamps are not slipping.  Take micro-ohm readings and check compression of fingers when blade aligns in jaw. Fill out PM sheet and scan to MTL ___________________________________________________________________________ For hotspot repairs  micro-ohm connection across hotspot  if major damage has occurred at hotspot connection point refer to engineering and replace connection parts (IE: new paddles, fingers, jaws, ECT) if no major pitting or metal degradation has occurred  Remove and inspect connection  clean connections, penetrox torque connections to spec perform micro-ohm readings after complete
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: micro-ohm meter manlift  penetrox scotchbrite drill wire brush grease oil
MATERIALS: penetrox  replacement fingers

WORK_OBJECTIVES: 3.0 PRECAUTIONS 3.1 Review and “Walk down” protection with Station Operator prior to obtaining work permit. 3.2 If there is live equipment in the proximity of the work area, provide barriers to indicate high voltage area. 3.3 Wear all appropriate personal protection. 3.4 All interrupter mechanisms SHALL be operated in a controlled manner. 3.5 Do not manually operate an energized circuit switcher. 3.6 Personnel SHALL keep clear of mechanisms that are to be operated or released.
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE THAT JOB BRIEFING IS HELD ONSITE  ENSURE SAFE DRIVING  COMMUNICATE WITH STATION OPERATOR AND OBTAIN WP as required Recommended HPI Tools: ATTENTION TO DETAIL, Two Minute Rule, & Questioning Attitude {See attached HPI TOOLBOX for guidance}  GO OVER PROTECTION  OBTAIN WORK P0ERMIT FOR SCAFFOLD TO BE ERRECTED ONCE SCAFFOLD IS UP, OBTAIN WORK PERMIT FOR PM INSPECTION START TO CLEAN THE SWITCH AS PER THE PROCEDURE   DAY TWO TAKE ALL READINGS MICRO-OHM TIMING FILL IN THE DATA SHEET IF ALL READINGS ARE GOOD CONTINUE THE INSPECTION DAY THREE OPERATION CHECKS AND SIGN OFF PERMIT REMOVE SCAFFOLD  5.1 As-Found Condition 5.2 Circuit Switcher Overall Resistance. 5.3 Interrupter Contact Timing. 5.4 Contact Timing – Interrupter and Disconnect. 5.5 Repairs and Adjustments. 5.6 Post Maintenance Inspection.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • 1000-volt Meg-ohm meter • Micro-ohm meter (100 amp DC) • Clamp-on meter • Barrier tape • Cleaner/Degreaser • Chain Lubricant • Disconnect Switch contact lubricant – Shell Darina EP2, Dow Corning DC44, or equivalent. • Lift or scaffold • Lint Free Rags • Personal Protective Equipment • Replacement parts as necessary • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • All-In-Lubricant Kit • Stop Watch • Timing set
MATERIALS: GREASE RAGS SCOTCH BRITE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: 3.0 PRECAUTIONS 3.1 Review and “Walk down” protection with Station Operator prior to obtaining work permit. 3.2 If there is live equipment in the proximity of the work area, provide barriers to indicate high voltage area. 3.3 Wear all appropriate personal protection. 3.4 All interrupter mechanisms SHALL be operated in a controlled manner. 3.5 Do not manually operate an energized circuit switcher. 3.6 Personnel SHALL keep clear of mechanisms that are to be operated or released.

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform breaker pm for a Powervac Vacuum Circuit Breaker with ML17/17H Mechanism as per Instruction 0700-0713  Perform breaker General Maintenance Perform breaker Interlock Inspection Perform Slow Closing Of The Circuit Breaker with Gap and Wipe Measurements Perform Contact Wipe And Gap Adjustment, as needed Check Erosion Indicator Perform Electrical Checks of the Stored Energy Operator Mechanism Perform breaker Lubrication  Perform breaker Cleaning Perform Final Tests for Vacuum Circuit Breakers Perform breaker Post Maintenance Inspection Perform Vacuum Integrity Test For breaker cubicles, perform cubicle pm 0700-0706 Perform a visual inspection of breaker cubicle Perform cleaning of cubicle Perform lubrication of cubicle components Perform vacuum integrity test Perform cubicle Final Checks Complete data splice round and create cm work orders for discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform breaker/cubicle PM as per Instructions 0700-0713 and 0700-0706
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • Dielectric Proof Test Set (listed below or equivalent): • Hipotronics Model 860 Pl, 880 PL or 7BT60A Biddle, Cat. # 222060 • Non-metallic rule • Feeler gage, 0.0015 – 0.200” • Dial caliper, 0.0 – 4.0” • Torque wrench, 1/2” drive, 0.0 – 175 ft-lb • 5/16” Allen wrench • 1/4" Square drive ratchet • 1/4” Square 3” extension • 7/16” Socket wrench • Square drive ratchet • 5/8” Socket wrench • 7/16”, 3/4", 15/16”, 1” and 1-1/8” Wrenches • Needle nose pliers • Slip joint pliers • Lint-free cloth • Reference wood block (2-7/8” x 6”)
MATERIALS: • All-In-One Lubrication Kit • Loctite # 271 or equivalent • Lubricant, grease, GE type 0282A2048P009 or equivalent • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • Barrier tape or equivalent barrier material / equipment • Masking tape
OTHER_GROUPS: Need operator to perform vacuum integrity test of breaker

WODESC: RM - PM DSW W-72-3Y & GRND SW W72-3Y-0 / W72-01

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a PM on a GE type LRT-400 & 500 Tap Changer Perform a Check of Initial Conditions Record all information required on the Data Sheet Perform an Operational Check of the tap changer Perform “as found” Megger test of the Secondary Windings Perform an Oil Drain from the LTC Compartment Perform an Inspection of the LTC Compartment Perform a Vacuum Bottle Inspection Check the Contact Wear Indicator on each Vacuum Bottle Perform an Inspection of the mechanism Perform a Vacuum Bottle Hi-Pot Test Perform a Mechanism Compartment Inspection Perform a Manual Sequence Test, if required Perform a Test of the Loss of Vacuum Circuit Perform a Compartment Closeout Perform a Vacuum Hot Oil Filling of the LTC Compartments Perform a Final Operational Check of the Tap Changer Perform an Inspection of the Bushing Potential Device Cable Observe and Record the “as left” Counter Reading Perform and Record a Megger test at 7000 Vdc for 5 minutes. Record on Data Sheet. Ensure Data Sheet is filled out completely If any readings are out of specification, please inform supervision immediately Enter a CM for any outstanding work required
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE THAT JOB BRIEFING IS HELD ONSITE  ENSURE SAFE DRIVING  COMMUNICATE WITH STATION OPERATOR AND OBTAIN WP as required Recommended HPI Tools: ATTENTION TO DETAIL, Two Minute Rule, & Questioning Attitude {See attached HPI TOOLBOX for guidance}  Perform a PM on a GE LRT-400 or 500 Tap Changer per Instruction 0600-0608 Check for availability of replacement parts including Vacuum Interrupter Bottles. All contacts should be available in case replacement is necessary. Jennings bottles are not to be DC Hi-Pot tested. Prior to entering compartment, verify circuit breaker (8V) is open and the plug connector is disconnected. Ensure datasheet is completely filled out If any readings are out of spec please inform supervision immediately
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • Oil processing unit • Hose • Scaffold • Rope • Oil pads • Marriage roll • Impact wrenches • Torque wrench • Rags • 5000 Vdc Megger • Microhm meter • Voltmeter and 110v test set/Variac for Loss of Vacuum Detection Circuit Test • Vacuum pump, pressure relief blanking plate, and other associated equipment • Gaskets, cotter pins and Tru-arc rings • All gaskets, cotter pins, and Tru-arc rings disturbed during inspection must be replaced with new • Door gasket must be replaced • Electrical tester (continuity tester or multi-meter) • Tygon tubing, thick wall • Waste oil drums, Labels and Lab Sequence number • Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) • Pull scale • 25 kVac Hi-Pot set or 30 kVdc Hi-Pot set • Oil Pump • Pure non-scented Vaseline (for Capacitance Tap on Transformer Bushing) • Bushing Potential Device (BPD) cables. • Replacement parts as necessary
MATERIALS: Insure Vacuum Bottles and all other contact  replacement parts are available.

Record on Data Sheet. Ensure Data Sheet is filled out completely If any readings are out of specification, please inform supervision immediately Enter a CM for any outstanding work required

WODESC: CIRCUIT BREAKER AUTO TRIP ALARM CAME UP AFTER CUTTING IN CAP BANK 1 VIA E.C.C.
WORK_OBJECTIVES: CHECK AND REPAIR CAUSE OF A FALSE CIRCUIT BKR AUTO TRIP ALARM EVER TIME CAP BANK 1 CIRCUIT BREAKER IS PLACE INTO SERVICE.
WORK_STEPS: 1 IN THE ALARM PANEL (JC04) PLACE A JUMPER ON POINTS TB7-8 TO TB1-8, IF THE ALARM CLEARS GO TO STEP 2, IF ALARM DOES NOT CLEAR REPLACE THE ALARM CARD. 2 IN THE 15MB CUBICLE PLACE A JUMPER ON POINTS B105 TO B106, IF THE ALARM CLEARS GO TO STEP 3, IF THE ALARM DOES NOT CLEAR CHECK FOR AN OPEN WIRE IN ANY PART OF THE ALARM CIRCUIT USING PRINT PK27-S-000015 TO TROUBLESHOOT THE CIRCUIT. 3 WITH THE CIRCUIT IN THE CLOSE POSITION (NOTE: THE BREAKER NEEDS TO BE IN THE TEST POSITION OR THE CONNECT POSITION FOR THIS TESTING) AND THE 74AT/C1 RELAY IS PICK UP (ENERGIZE), PLACE A JUMPER ON POINTS BME1 TO BME2, IF THE ALARM CLEARS CHECK FOR AN OPEN 52MOC SW  CONTACT OR OPEN CIRCUIT FROM POINTS BME1 TO BME2, IF THE ALARM DOES NOT CLEAR CHECK FOR AN OPEN CIRCUIT FROM POINT 2 TO POINT 10 ON THE 74AT/C1 RELAY.  PLANNER NOTE: LOOSE ROTARY SW OR LINKAGE ON THE MOC SW. LOOSE CONNECTION OF THE WIRES ON THE MOC FOR THE AUTO TRIP CKT. MISALIGNMENT OF THE MOC SW TO BKR OPERATING ROD CAUSING THE MOC SW NOT TO MOVE TO ITS PROPER CLOSE POSITION. BENT OPERATING LINKAGE. WHEN YOU CLOSE THE CIRCUIT BREAKER THE 74AT/C1 RELAY SHOULD PICK UP AND SEAL ITSELF IN AUTOMATICALLY IF THIS DOES NOT HAPPEN CHECK FOR THE FOLLOWING. A MECHANICAL PROBLEM WITH THE RELAY. LOW CURRENT TO THE RELAY CAUSE BY THE 500 OHM RESISTOR MORE THAN 500 OHMS. THE MOC SW CONTACT NOT MAKING UP PROPERLY WHEN THE CIRCUIT BREAKER CLOSES. USE PRINT # 1991M01552
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: STANDARD MECHANIC TOOL KIT DIGITAL MULTUMETER JUMPERS

WODESC: TRANSFORMER 1S 120/208 AC ATOS WILL NOT SWAP TO EMERGENCY
FIRE HYDRANT ANNUAL TEST AND  INSPECTION (2 HYDRANTS)
CUB 33N - OUTAGE TO INSPECT CUBICLE AFTER 32S AND 33S OPEN/AUTO
FOLLOW-UP FOR SSO FDR 24056  TR5 TC : GARD ALARM & 86N-2/T5 MONITORING CKT RESISTOR BURNED OFF

WORK_OBJECTIVES: 3.0 PRECAUTIONS 3.1 Review and “Walk down” protection with Station Operator prior to obtaining work permit. 3.2 If there is live equipment in the proximity of the work area, provide barriers to indicate high voltage area. 3.3 Wear all appropriate personal protection. 3.4 All interrupter mechanisms SHALL be operated in a controlled manner. 3.5 Do not manually operate an energized circuit switcher. 3.6 Personnel SHALL keep clear of mechanisms that are to be operated or released.
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE THAT JOB BRIEFING IS HELD ONSITE  ENSURE SAFE DRIVING  COMMUNICATE WITH STATION OPERATOR AND OBTAIN WP as required Recommended HPI Tools: ATTENTION TO DETAIL, Two Minute Rule, & Questioning Attitude {See attached HPI TOOLBOX for guidance}  GO OVER PROTECTION  OBTAIN WORK PERMIT FOR SCAFFOLD TO BE ERRECTED if Required ONCE SCAFFOLD IS UP (if required), OBTAIN WORK PERMIT FOR PM INSPECTION FOLLOW SSO MAINTENANCE INSTRUCTION FILL IN THE DATA SHEET IF ALL READINGS ARE GOOD CONTINUE THE INSPECTION 5.1 As-Found Condition 5.2 Circuit Switcher Overall Resistance. 5.3 Interrupter Contact Timing. 5.4 Contact Timing – Interrupter and Disconnect. 5.5 Repairs and Adjustments. 5.6 Post Maintenance Inspection.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • 1000-volt Meg-ohm meter • Micro-ohm meter (100 amp DC) • Clamp-on meter • Barrier tape • Cleaner/Degreaser • Chain Lubricant • Disconnect Switch contact lubricant – Shell Darina EP2, Dow Corning DC44, or equivalent. • Lift or scaffold • Lint Free Rags • Personal Protective Equipment • Replacement parts as necessary • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • All-In-Lubricant Kit • Stop Watch • Timing set
MATERIALS: GREASE RAGS SCOTCH BRITE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: repair ground switch 257 Not going into jaw
WORK_STEPS: ensure to receive a comprehensive job briefing use the 2 minute rule / ask what is the worst thing that can happen operate switch / check to see where it is binding or where it is mis-aligned adjust switch as needed  Microohm the connection  notify supervision if there are any discrepancies complete datasplice is required
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools, 45 foot man lift , double 4/0 ground for the lift , harnesses,

WODESC: REPAIR SUBSTATION ROAD DRAIN AS PER ESR 2018-19069

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a minor DT breaker pm for an ABB PM-63 Breaker Record SF6 pressure Perform SF6 gas testing, record results Perform visual inspection of breaker condition Perform check of cabinet heaters Perform check of cabinet door gaskets Inspect cabinet for leaks and corrosion Inspect Hydraulic system for leaks Perform check of oil level Report SF6 leak checks performed (if gas call in the last 5 years) Perform inspection of auxiliary switches and control relays Perform inspection of control wiring, linkage, indicators and lights Perform required cleaning Perform required lubrication Perform a micro ohm reading Perform timing tests  Record the as left counter reading Perform a final inspection of the Circuit Breaker Inform Supervisor of any readings out of spec. (Supervisor shall review such readings with Engineering) Complete datasheet, data splice round, and create cm work orders for discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform Minor DT as per procedure 0770-0001 Chem Lab is to test for the below (Instruction currently being updated): Moisture Content, Purity, SO2 Close timing - should be 50-85 (datasheet has to be updated) Open velocity - 13.4-15.7 (Instruction has to be updated)
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Manlift Micro Ohm Meter Fluke Timing Set SF6 Gas Sniffer Leak Tech Laser Camera Wiring Tools Hand Tools Ladders Tarps Rope
MATERIALS: Contact Grease Absorbent Pads Duct Tape Binding Wire Lint Free Cloth Rags Solvent

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Repair Asco Throw-Over Associated with 1S
WORK_STEPS: Report to Eastview substation and remove ASCO control card. Tag Panel Defective and inform operator that throw-over will not swap over in current condition Tag and label ASCO card Bring card to Astoria tech lab for repairs.   Go to Astoria and pick up ASCO Alarm card  Re-install card and check for proper operation of throw-over switch

TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Hand tools Wiring tools Fluke meter

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WODESC: CEP-2.4 SPDES - TAKE SAMPLES FROM WASTE WATER TANK
ACADEMY STREET-PUMPHOUSE-PH M29 ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WODESC: P WEB-PURS PLANT-M72S ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection. Monthly Inspection. Physical inspection. Electrolyte levels. Battery charger float voltage. Battery charger float current. Battery room ventilation. Quarterly Inspection. All of the above plus; Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity. Record battery room temperature. Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars. Annual Inspection. Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance. Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness. Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances. Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter. As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries. Battery Inspection Data. Emergency Charge. Equalizing Charge.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WODESC: P E147-PURS PLANT-M72N ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection. Monthly Inspection. Physical inspection. Electrolyte levels. Battery charger float voltage. Battery charger float current. Battery room ventilation. Quarterly Inspection. All of the above plus; Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity. Record battery room temperature. Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars. Annual Inspection. Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance. Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness. Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances. Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter. As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries. Battery Inspection Data. Emergency Charge. Equalizing Charge.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.

MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform breaker pm for a Powervac Vacuum Circuit Breaker with ML17/17H Mechanism as per Instruction 0700-0713  Perform breaker General Maintenance Perform breaker Interlock Inspection Perform Slow Closing Of The Circuit Breaker with Gap and Wipe Measurements Perform Contact Wipe And Gap Adjustment, as needed Check Erosion Indicator Perform Electrical Checks of the Stored Energy Operator Mechanism Perform breaker Lubrication  Perform breaker Cleaning Perform Final Tests for Vacuum Circuit Breakers Perform breaker Post Maintenance Inspection Perform Vacuum Integrity Test For breaker cubicles, perform cubicle pm 0700-0706 Perform a visual inspection of breaker cubicle Perform cleaning of cubicle Perform lubrication of cubicle components Perform vacuum integrity test Perform cubicle Final Checks Complete data splice round and create cm work orders for discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform breaker/cubicle PM as per Instructions 0700-0713 and 0700-0706
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • Dielectric Proof Test Set (listed below or equivalent): • Hipotronics Model 860 Pl, 880 PL or 7BT60A Biddle, Cat. # 222060 • Non-metallic rule • Feeler gage, 0.0015 – 0.200” • Dial caliper, 0.0 – 4.0” • Torque wrench, 1/2” drive, 0.0 – 175 ft-lb • 5/16” Allen wrench • 1/4" Square drive ratchet • 1/4” Square 3” extension • 7/16” Socket wrench • Square drive ratchet • 5/8” Socket wrench • 7/16”, 3/4", 15/16”, 1” and 1-1/8” Wrenches • Needle nose pliers • Slip joint pliers • Lint-free cloth • Reference wood block (2-7/8” x 6”)
MATERIALS: • All-In-One Lubrication Kit • Loctite # 271 or equivalent • Lubricant, grease, GE type 0282A2048P009 or equivalent • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • Barrier tape or equivalent barrier material / equipment • Masking tape
OTHER_GROUPS: Need operator to perform vacuum integrity test of breaker

WORK_STEPS: Perform breaker/cubicle PM as per Instructions 0700-0713 and 0700-0706
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • Dielectric Proof Test Set (listed below or equivalent): • Hipotronics Model 860 Pl, 880 PL or 7BT60A Biddle, Cat. # 222060 • Non-metallic rule • Feeler gage, 0.0015 – 0.200” • Dial caliper, 0.0 – 4.0” • Torque wrench, 1/2” drive, 0.0 – 175 ft-lb • 5/16” Allen wrench • 1/4" Square drive ratchet • 1/4” Square 3” extension • 7/16” Socket wrench • Square drive ratchet • 5/8” Socket wrench • 7/16”, 3/4", 15/16”, 1” and 1-1/8” Wrenches • Needle nose pliers • Slip joint pliers • Lint-free cloth • Reference wood block (2-7/8” x 6”)
MATERIALS: • All-In-One Lubrication Kit • Loctite # 271 or equivalent • Lubricant, grease, GE type 0282A2048P009 or equivalent • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • Barrier tape or equivalent barrier material / equipment • Masking tape

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete the semi-annual hotspot inspection for the station Follow procedure 0500-0015 Analyze and download pictures Enter hotspot in Engage hotspot module Create Maximo for all hotspot above monitoring level Complete Datasplice job plan  Provide the Supervisor/Planner with the list of hotspots found
WORK_STEPS: Please make a request from the desk, to have the cap banks put in service 1 at a time to shoot the hotspots, the night before.  If no operator is present follow procedure 0300 - 0061.  Notify Supervision immediately if any equipment is discovered to have a Hot Spot that meets the Off on Emergency Category II (OOE2) qualification.  To enter new hotspots in Engage: Click on the New Hot Spot Entry Link (in attachments) Enter all required information Upload hotspot picture Click save -if a hotspot for the equipment already exist  -and the location is the same   -Click select to add new picture and temperature for hotspot -If hotspot is on same equipment but different location  -Click create new hotspot to save all data
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Infrared camera Computer with FLIR software

WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.

MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Objective  Perform Stray Voltage Testing -Test for voltage on steel, aluminum, other electrical conducting materials in substations Inspect all perimeter fence and swing gates  -Ensure all are properly connected to ground via 4/0 cable -Perform easy repair such as    - reattaching a ground, tightening a connection point..etc.
WORK_STEPS: 1. Ensure you receive DOJT CSG0020 from the supervisor -Each time inspection is to be performed -Supervisor is to ensure it is reflect in the employees training record 2. Review section 5.4.9 in CE-ES-2002 Part 10 Substation Grounding 3. Review DRW 181895 for fence grounding specifications 4. Ensure datasplice round with station inspection points is provided 5. Proceed to follow the ppt and complete inspection 6. Complete the datasplice round  -Create CM work order for any discrepancies found 7. Inform the supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Stray Voltage Pen & tester Distance meter Fluke Meter Hand tools

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_STEPS: 1. Ensure you receive DOJT CSG0020 from the supervisor -Each time inspection is to be performed -Supervisor is to ensure it is reflect in the employees training record 2. Ensure datasplice round with site specific questions is provided 3. Proceed to follow the ppt 4. Complete the datasplice round  -Create CM work order for any discrepancies found 5. Inform the supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Clip board
MATERIALS: Writing pad pen

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Objective  Perform Stray Voltage Testing -Test for voltage on steel, aluminum, other electrical conducting materials in substations Inspect all perimeter fence and swing gates  -Ensure all are properly connected to ground via 4/0 cable -Perform easy repair such as    - reattaching a ground, tightening a connection point..etc.
WORK_STEPS: 1. Ensure you receive DOJT CSG0020 from the supervisor -Each time inspection is to be performed -Supervisor is to ensure it is reflect in the employees training record 2. Review section 5.4.9 in CE-ES-2002 Part 10 Substation Grounding 3. Review DRW 181895 for fence grounding specifications 4. Ensure datasplice round with station inspection points is provided 5. Proceed to follow the ppt and complete inspection 6. Complete the datasplice round  -Create CM work order for any discrepancies found 7. Inform the supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Stray Voltage Pen & tester Distance meter Fluke Meter Hand tools

WODESC: FIRE PUMP PM AND FLOW TEST
MOTT HAVEN LP4 TRANSFORMER INSPECTION (DRY TYPE)
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform PM on L&P transformer Perform visual inspection of transformer Check ground connections Perform cleaning of transformer Take picture of transformer nameplate and transformer overall and provide to management Upload all pictures to MTL or provide to supervision for uploading Complete datasplice round, create cm work order for any issues that could not be resolved during inspection Inform supervisor of an issues
WORK_STEPS: SSM to perform Preventative Maintenance on Light and Power Transformer  Light and Power Transformer should be out of service and grounded Perform external visual inspection Remove the side panels for access to make an internal inspection Perform internal visual inspection Perform a visual inspection of all current carrying copper and connections Check for signs of components over heating Vacuum/clean all contaminates (dust) from the insulating surfaces? Check any terminal boxes installed for any signs of water entry, corroded terminal boxes etc. Check ground connections Take nameplate picture Take pictures of internal components once they have been cleaned Upload pictures to MTL or provide pictures to supervision for uploading Restore any plates remove Complete datasplice round, create cm work order as required *Note: pictures provided in attachments are not of actual transformer and are to serve as reference
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Camera
MATERIALS: Denatured Alcohol Garbage Bags Oil Pads Rags Simple Green

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022  Perform visual inspection. Check Electrolyte levels. Check Battery charger float voltage. Check Battery charger float current. Assess Battery room ventilation. Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity and record the temperature for 25% of the battery cells. Record battery room temperature. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars as needed

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection. Monthly Inspection. Physical inspection. Electrolyte levels. Battery charger float voltage. Battery charger float current. Battery room ventilation. Quarterly Inspection. All of the above plus; Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity. Record battery room temperature. Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars. Annual Inspection. Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance. Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness. Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances. Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter. As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries. Battery Inspection Data. Emergency Charge. Equalizing Charge.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter. As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries. Battery Inspection Data. Emergency Charge. Equalizing Charge.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. WORK_OBJECTIVES: Follow instruction 0800-0029, including the following:  Plugs, Catch Basins and Manholes  If oil is present, call the Spill Desk  Check for debris  Remove cover over petro-barrier and inspect filter media Replace/washout media as required Trough Barriers Inspection must be performed by lifting trough covers on either side of the trough barrier  If oil is present, call Spill Desk Check for debris and replace/washout media as required For Sump Oil Water Filtration Inspection Follow provided instructions If oil is present, call Spill Desk Check for debris and replace/washout media as required Complete datasplice round  Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: PRECAUTIONS Confined Space procedure (Corporate Environmental, Health and Safety Procedure CEHSP S16.00, “Permit Required Confined Space Program) must be followed for any installation in a surveyed confined space. If unsure of space classification, contact your local EH&S representative. Wear all appropriate personal protective equipment. Site specific map to be added to job package
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Man hole hooks shovel broom 55 gallon wet/dry vacuum Leather Gloves Nitrate Gloves Fork lift
MATERIALS: Spare Petro Plugs Batting Filter Media Garbage Bags Vipor 100 SOWF 7x20 pre-filter sock(C2-E-00550)
OTHER_GROUPS: Add station SPCC Plan  CIAGENT POC (Vipor 100 SOWF) Dan Koons Regional Manager Secondary Containment & Coatings Mobile: 502-314-0319 DKoons@justrite.com>  www.ciagent.com

WODESC: MOTT HAVEN LP5 TRANSFORMER INSPECTION (DRY TYPE)
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform PM on L&P transformer Perform visual inspection of transformer Check ground connections Perform cleaning of transformer Take picture of transformer nameplate and transformer overall and provide to management Upload all pictures to MTL or provide to supervision for uploading Complete datasplice round, create cm work order for any issues that could not be resolved during inspection Inform supervisor of an issues
WORK_STEPS: SSM to perform Preventative Maintenance on Light and Power Transformer  Light and Power Transformer should be out of service and grounded Perform external visual inspection Remove the side panels for access to make an internal inspection Perform internal visual inspection Perform a visual inspection of all current carrying copper and connections Check for signs of components over heating Vacuum/clean all contaminates (dust) from the insulating surfaces? Check any terminal boxes installed for any signs of water entry, corroded terminal boxes etc. Check ground connections Take nameplate picture Take pictures of internal components once they have been cleaned Upload pictures to MTL or provide pictures to supervision for uploading Restore any plates remove Complete datasplice round, create cm work order as required *Note: pictures provided in attachments are not of actual transformer and are to serve as reference
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Camera
MATERIALS: Denatured Alcohol Garbage Bags Oil Pads Rags Simple Green

WORK_OBJECTIVES: High Voltage Test Set PM as per Procedure 0500-0012
WORK_STEPS: Perform Job Briefing Onsite & Ensure Safe Driving Recommended HPI TOOLS: Procedure Use & Adherence; Place Keeping; & Attention to Detail [SEE ATTACHED HPI TOOLBOX) Perform HVTS PM as per attached Procedure 0500-12 Complete Data splice Round Leave work-site clean.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Grounding Stick Mechanic As Toolbox
MATERIALS: no special material required

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete the semi-annual hotspot inspection for the station Follow procedure 0500-0015 Analyze and download pictures Enter hotspot in Engage hotspot module Create Maximo for all hotspot above monitoring level Complete Datasplice job plan  Provide the Supervisor/Planner with the list of hotspots found
WORK_STEPS: Please make a request from the desk, to have the cap banks put in service 1 at a time to shoot the hotspots, the night before.  If no operator is present follow procedure 0300 - 0061.  Notify Supervision immediately if any equipment is discovered to have a Hot Spot that meets the Off on Emergency Category II (OOE2) qualification.  To enter new hotspots in Engage: Click on the New Hot Spot Entry Link (in attachments) Enter all required information Upload hotspot picture Click save -if a hotspot for the equipment already exist  -and the location is the same   -Click select to add new picture and temperature for hotspot -If hotspot is on same equipment but different location  -Click create new hotspot to save all data
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Infrared camera Computer with FLIR software

WODESC: FIRE EXT ANNUAL MAINTENANCE CHECK - VENDOR
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Safety person for vendor to perform work - Perform annual inspection of fire extinguishers Monitor vendors work and activities -Vendor to inspect all fire extinguisher onsite and install new inspection card at each extinguisher -Vendor to replace all fire extinguishers that do not pass inspection during inspection, if possible -Vendor to provide quantity of fire extinguishers and type replaced, safety person to provide this information to supervisor  -If vendor cannot replace all failed extinguishers, he is to provide a list of type, quantity, and location of each extinguisher to safety person, who shall give to supervisor for ordering Complete contractor oversight form Complete datasplice round at end of job -Ensure to provide information for any failed fire extinguishers vendor cannot replace include type, quantity, and location of each extinguisher  Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Ensure contractors sign in and are issued contractor id badges -Badges are kept by operators Perform job briefing at job site Review HASP with vendor and safety person Monitor vendor activities and provide any coordination required Notify management of any safety incidents Completed contractor Field Observation Form (CFOR) for vendor -Click on link "Contractor Oversight System" in attachments -Click on CFOR -Click "Create"  -Change organization to "Substation Operations"  -If completing work for a different organization select from drop down -Click "Contractor Field Observation" and then submit  -Form should come up to complete  -Area management should provide PO for vendor Complete datasplice round on daily basis -answer is work complete "No" until last day of job and then change answer to "Yes"  Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: pen/paper

WODESC: FM-200 FIRE SUPPRESSION SYSTEM - 6 MONTH TESTING

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_STEPS: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection. Monthly Inspection. Physical inspection. Electrolyte levels. Battery charger float voltage. Battery charger float current. Battery room ventilation. Quarterly Inspection. All of the above plus; Measure the battery terminal voltage. Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors. Check the electrolyte level. Measure individual cell specific gravity. Record battery room temperature. Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells. Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar. Clean the jars. Annual Inspection. Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance. Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness. Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances. Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter. As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries. Battery Inspection Data. Emergency Charge. Equalizing Charge.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WODESC: ELMSFORD CDS UNIT PR-12 ANNUAL INSPECTION
ROOF DRAINAGE TO BE CLEARED, STAIRS SECURED

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform breaker pm for a Powervac Vacuum Circuit Breaker with ML17/17H Mechanism as per Instruction 0700-0713  Perform breaker General Maintenance Perform breaker Interlock Inspection Perform Slow Closing Of The Circuit Breaker with Gap and Wipe Measurements Perform Contact Wipe And Gap Adjustment, as needed Check Erosion Indicator Perform Electrical Checks of the Stored Energy Operator Mechanism Perform breaker Lubrication  Perform breaker Cleaning Perform Final Tests for Vacuum Circuit Breakers Perform breaker Post Maintenance Inspection Perform Vacuum Integrity Test For breaker cubicles, perform cubicle pm 0700-0706 Perform a visual inspection of breaker cubicle Perform cleaning of cubicle Perform lubrication of cubicle components Perform vacuum integrity test Perform cubicle Final Checks Complete data splice round and create cm work orders for discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform breaker/cubicle PM as per Instructions 0700-0713 and 0700-0706  Located on the floor in section 4
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • Dielectric Proof Test Set (listed below or equivalent): • Hipotronics Model 860 Pl, 880 PL or 7BT60A Biddle, Cat. # 222060 • Non-metallic rule • Feeler gage, 0.0015 – 0.200” • Dial caliper, 0.0 – 4.0” • Torque wrench, 1/2” drive, 0.0 – 175 ft-lb • 5/16” Allen wrench • 1/4" Square drive ratchet • 1/4” Square 3” extension • 7/16” Socket wrench • Square drive ratchet • 5/8” Socket wrench • 7/16”, 3/4", 15/16”, 1” and 1-1/8” Wrenches • Needle nose pliers • Slip joint pliers • Lint-free cloth • Reference wood block (2-7/8” x 6”)
MATERIALS: • All-In-One Lubrication Kit • Loctite # 271 or equivalent • Lubricant, grease, GE type 0282A2048P009 or equivalent • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • Barrier tape or equivalent barrier material / equipment • Masking tape
OTHER_GROUPS: Need operator to perform vacuum integrity test of breaker
