WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform quarterly or semi-annual inspection  of battery per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per procedure 0500-0022

MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed

WODESC: NEW FAN GUARDS REQUIRED FOR TR2 (LESS THAN 7 FT)
0500-15  HOT SPOT INSPECTION - WINTER *CONSOLIDATE GRANITE HILL HTOD*
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete the semi-annual hotspot inspection for the station Follow procedure 0500-0015 Analyze and download pictures Enter hotspot in Engage hotspot module Create Maximo for all hotspot above monitoring level Complete Datasplice job plan  Provide the Supervisor/Planner with the list of hotspots found
WORK_STEPS: Please make a request from the desk, to have the cap banks put in service 1 at a time to shoot the hotspots, the night before.  If no operator is present follow procedure 0300 - 0061.  Notify Supervision immediately if any equipment is discovered to have a Hot Spot that meets the Off on Emergency Category II (OOE2) qualification.  To enter new hotspots in Engage: Click on the New Hot Spot Entry Link (in attachments) Enter all required information Upload hotspot picture Click save -if a hotspot for the equipment already exist  -and the location is the same   -Click select to add new picture and temperature for hotspot -If hotspot is on same equipment but different location  -Click create new hotspot to save all data
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Infrared camera Computer with FLIR software

To enter new hotspots in Engage: Click on the New Hot Spot Entry Link (in attachments) Enter all required information Upload hotspot picture Click save -if a hotspot for the equipment already exist  -and the location is the same   -Click select to add new picture and temperature for hotspot -If hotspot is on same equipment but different location  -Click create new hotspot to save all data
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Infrared camera Computer with FLIR software

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform PM and Check and Repair Leak on A & C Phase 3.0 PRECAUTIONS 3.1 Review and “Walk down” protection with Station Operator prior to obtaining work permit. 3.2 If there is live equipment in the proximity of the work area, provide barriers to indicate high voltage area. 3.3 Wear all appropriate personal protection. 3.4 All interrupter mechanisms SHALL be operated in a controlled manner. 3.5 Do not manually operate an energized circuit switcher. 3.6 Personnel SHALL keep clear of mechanisms that are to be operated or released.

WODESC: N TRANSITION ANNUAL DIESEL GEN BATTERY INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Batteries and perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries Perform a physical inspection Record battery charger float voltage Record battery charger float current Measure and enter ripple current Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Record room temperature Measure all cell/unit internal impedance Measure all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Upload cell voltage, impedance, and resistance readings Complete datasplice round, create cm work order as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Batteries and perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Gloves  Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform breaker pm for a Powervac Vacuum Circuit Breaker with ML18 Mechanism Perform visual inspection of breaker condition Perform inspection of breaker components (i.e. wiring, bolted connections) Perform inspection of Primary Disconnects Perform Spring Discharge Interlocking System Tests Slow close of Circuit Breaker Check Contact Wipe Check Contact Gap. Check Contact Erosion Perform electrical Checks of Stored Energy Operating Mechanism Perform Lubrication of breaker components Perform breaker cleaning Perform micro-ohm Perform Breaker Timing Tests Perform a vacuum integrity test Perform insulation resistance testing (open & closed positions) Check and record the counter reading Perform a final inspection of the circuit breaker For breaker cubicles, perform cubicle pm 0700-0706 Perform a visual inspection of breaker cubicle Perform cleaning of cubicle Perform lubrication of cubicle components Check compartment heater and thermostat Check compartment lighting and receptacles Complete data splice round and create cm work orders for discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform breaker/cubicle pm Follow Instruction 0700-0715 and 0700-0706 and ensure objectives are all completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • 2500 volt Meg-ohm-meter • Micro-Ohm Meter • Dielectric Proof Test Set (listed below or equivalent): • Hipotronics Model 860 Pl, 880 PL or 7BT60A Biddle, Cat. # 222060 • Non-metallic rule • Wiring tools • Barrier tape or equivalent barrier material / equipment • Masking tape • Feeler gage, 0.0015 – 0.200” • Dial caliper, 0.0 – 4.0” • Torque wrench, 1/2” drive, 0.0 – 175 ft-lb • 5/16” Allen wrench • 1/4" Square drive ratchet • 1/4” Square 3” extension • 7/16” Socket wrench • Square drive ratchet • 5/8” Socket wrench • 7/16”, 3/4", 15/16”, 1” and 1-1/8” Wrenches • Needle nose pliers • Slip joint pliers • Lint-free cloth • Reference wood block (2-7/8” x 6”)
MATERIALS: • All-In-One Lubrication Kit • Loctite # 271 or equivalent • Lubricant, grease, GE type 0282A2048P009 or equivalent • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a minor DT breaker pm for an ABB PM-63 Breaker Record SF6 pressure Perform SF6 gas testing, record results Perform visual inspection of breaker condition Perform check of cabinet heaters Perform check of cabinet door gaskets Inspect cabinet for leaks and corrosion Inspect Hydraulic system for leaks Perform check of oil level Report SF6 leak checks performed (if gas call in the last 5 years) Perform inspection of auxiliary switches and control relays Perform inspection of control wiring, linkage, indicators and lights Perform required cleaning Perform required lubrication Perform a micro ohm reading Perform timing tests  Record the as left counter reading Perform a final inspection of the Circuit Breaker Inform Supervisor of any readings out of spec. (Supervisor shall review such readings with Engineering) Complete datasheet, data splice round, and create cm work orders for discrepancies

MATERIALS: Contact Grease Absorbent Pads Duct Tape Binding Wire Lint Free Cloth Rags Solvent

WODESC: DUAL ELECTRICAL INDICATION AT ECC ON BREAKER WHEN OPEN

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform quarterly or semi-annual inspection  of battery per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WODESC: CONTROLLER FOR PUMP FACILITY DISC ERROR 500  CONSTANT ALARM
2 BULBS OUT AND FUEL TEST LIGHT ON (130V/20MA BULB)
SIGNAGE FOR CONTROL CABINETS IN CONTROL ROOM
OSHA SAFETY FANS OR METAL GUARDS OF TRG3
OSSIN W TR 1 SECONDARY BUS INSP
OSSIN W TR 1 SECONDARY BUS INSP
ACADEMY HVAC UNITS NOT WORKING (RTU-1 & HV-3)

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Troubleshoot/repair cubicle indication, position 5TR shows indeterminate when open Use provided prints Ensure indications work properly after repair Complete Datasplice round Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: #14 wire

WODESC: ATTEMPTED TO OPEN VIA XA-21, STATUS GOES INDETERIMINANT, WHEN SSO WENT TO VERIFY ONLY N644 WAS OPEN
TR-2 BKR - BREAKER SHOWS CLOSED WHEN OPEN
WORK_OBJECTIVES: CHECK AND REPAIR CAUSE OF THE ECC RECEIVING AN INDETERMINATE INDICATION WHEN THE BKR IS CUT-OUT BY XA21. (DOES NOT SHOW OPEN.
WORK_STEPS: 1-WITH THE BKR IN THE OPEN POSITION CHECK WITH THE ECC IF THE BKR SHOWS OPEN OR INDETERMINATE, IF THE BKR SHOWS INDETERMINATE GO TO STEP 2, IF THE BKR SHOWS OPEN NO REPAIR IS NEEDED.   2-CONNECT A VOLTAGE METER TO POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1), THE VOLTAGE SHOULD READ POSITION (+) 24V DC, IF THE VOLTAGE IS PRESENT GO TO STEP 3, IF THE VOLTAGE  IS NOT PRESENT CHECK THE FOLLOWING: 2A-IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) AT POINT P8 A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC SHOULD BE PRESENT. 2B-IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) AT POINT X5 A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC SHOULD BE PRESENT. 2C-IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1)  AT POINT TR2 A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC SHOULD BE PRESENT.  IF NO VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) AND VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT P8 IN THE 13KV 138KV I/F CABINET (BB), THEN CHECK FOR AN OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE FROM POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) TO POINT P8 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB). REPAIR AS NEEDED. IF NO VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT P8 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) AND VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT X5 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB), THEN CHECK FOR AN OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE/DEFECTIVE RELAY FROM POINT P8 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) TO POINT X5 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) . REPAIR AS NEEDED. IF NO VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT X5 IN THE 13KV 138KV I/F CABINET (BB), AND VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT TR2 IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) THEN CHECK FOR AN OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE FROM POINT TR2 IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) TO POINT X5 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB). REPAIR AS NEEDED.    3-IN THE 13.8KV INTERFACE CABINET AT POINT RB9-5 CHECK FOR A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC, IF THE VOLTAGE IS PRESENT THEN NOTIFY PST OF A POSSIBLE XA21 PROBLEM TO THE ECC, IF THE VOLTAGE IS NOT PRESENT CHECK FOR A OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE BETWEEN POINT RB9-5 IN THE 13.KV I/F CABINET (JA8) TO POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) ALSO CHECK FOR A OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE FROM POINT TR2 TO 10A FUSE IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) .  REPAIR AS NEEDED.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: STANDARD MECHANIC TOOL KIT DIGITAL MULTIMETER

WODESC: TR-2 BKR - BREAKER SHOWS CLOSED WHEN OPEN
WORK_OBJECTIVES: CHECK AND REPAIR CAUSE OF THE ECC RECEIVING AN INDETERMINATE INDICATION WHEN THE BKR IS CUT-OUT BY XA21. (DOES NOT SHOW OPEN.
WORK_STEPS: 1-WITH THE BKR IN THE OPEN POSITION CHECK WITH THE ECC IF THE BKR SHOWS OPEN OR INDETERMINATE, IF THE BKR SHOWS INDETERMINATE GO TO STEP 2, IF THE BKR SHOWS OPEN NO REPAIR IS NEEDED.   2-CONNECT A VOLTAGE METER TO POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1), THE VOLTAGE SHOULD READ POSITION (+) 24V DC, IF THE VOLTAGE IS PRESENT GO TO STEP 3, IF THE VOLTAGE  IS NOT PRESENT CHECK THE FOLLOWING: 2A-IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) AT POINT P8 A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC SHOULD BE PRESENT. 2B-IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) AT POINT X5 A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC SHOULD BE PRESENT. 2C-IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1)  AT POINT TR2 A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC SHOULD BE PRESENT.  IF NO VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) AND VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT P8 IN THE 13KV 138KV I/F CABINET (BB), THEN CHECK FOR AN OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE FROM POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) TO POINT P8 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB). REPAIR AS NEEDED. IF NO VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT P8 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) AND VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT X5 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB), THEN CHECK FOR AN OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE/DEFECTIVE RELAY FROM POINT P8 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) TO POINT X5 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB) . REPAIR AS NEEDED. IF NO VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT X5 IN THE 13KV 138KV I/F CABINET (BB), AND VOLTAGE IS PRESENT AT POINT TR2 IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) THEN CHECK FOR AN OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE FROM POINT TR2 IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) TO POINT X5 IN THE 138KV I/F CABINET (BB). REPAIR AS NEEDED.    3-IN THE 13.8KV INTERFACE CABINET AT POINT RB9-5 CHECK FOR A POSITIVE (+) 24V DC, IF THE VOLTAGE IS PRESENT THEN NOTIFY PST OF A POSSIBLE XA21 PROBLEM TO THE ECC, IF THE VOLTAGE IS NOT PRESENT CHECK FOR A OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE BETWEEN POINT RB9-5 IN THE 13.KV I/F CABINET (JA8) TO POINT 53A IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) ALSO CHECK FOR A OPEN LINK/BROKEN WIRE FROM POINT TR2 TO 10A FUSE IN THE 13KV CONTROL BOARD BUS SECT"S. 1 & 2 PANEL #1 (JB1) .  REPAIR AS NEEDED.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: STANDARD MECHANIC TOOL KIT DIGITAL MULTIMETER

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WODESC: P SPBRK-PURS PLANT-M52 ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WODESC: 0500-0701 (A) EMERG DIESEL GEN INSP- DUN SO
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete compliance according to 500-0701
WORK_STEPS: Ensure Safe Driving****SECRUE LOADS ON RIG******  Perform Job Briefing Onsite Recommended HPI TOOLS: Procedure Use & Adherence; Place Keeping; & Attention to Detail [SEE ATTACHED HPI TOOLBOX)  ***ENSURE ELECTRICAL SAFETY*** Check Dead Prior to Touching any COPPER!!!! VERIFY PROTECTION !!!  ***If DG is found to be Unavailable for service for any reason during the PM Immediately NOTIFY the station operator and your Supervisor!!!  Review Procedure 0500-0701 Perform DG PM as per attached procedure ****PPE***While unit is running ensure hearing protection  Complete Data splice Round Create Drum Log in Data Splice  Complete request Drum Pick UP  Email request Drum Pickup to station supervisor/Local EHS Rep: Leave work-site clean  Report Status to Supervisor at end of shift
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Mechanics A tool box  HPI Tool Box  Strap wrench  Ear Protection
MATERIALS: Reference Exhibit A from 0500-0701 Sample Jars  Fuel Filter  Oil filters  Lubricants  Engine oil 15W40 Drain Pans  Two 5 gal Pail  One 55 gal liquid drum   Drum labels: Use oil; Hazardous waste

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC

MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WODESC: P DUN-PURS PLANT-71 ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete compliance according to 500-0701
WORK_STEPS: Ensure Safe Driving****SECRUE LOADS ON RIG******  Perform Job Briefing Onsite Recommended HPI TOOLS: Procedure Use & Adherence; Place Keeping; & Attention to Detail [SEE ATTACHED HPI TOOLBOX)  ***ENSURE ELECTRICAL SAFETY*** Check Dead Prior to Touching any COPPER!!!! VERIFY PROTECTION !!!  ***If DG is found to be Unavailable for service for any reason during the PM Immediately NOTIFY the station operator and your Supervisor!!!  Review Procedure 0500-0701 Perform DG PM as per attached procedure ****PPE***While unit is running ensure hearing protection  Complete Data splice Round Create Drum Log in Data Splice  Complete request Drum Pick UP  Email request Drum Pickup to station supervisor/Local EHS Rep: Leave work-site clean  Report Status to Supervisor at end of shift
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Mechanics A tool box  HPI Tool Box  Strap wrench  Ear Protection
MATERIALS: Reference Exhibit A from 0500-0701 Sample Jars  Fuel Filter  Oil filters  Lubricants  Engine oil 15W40 Drain Pans  Two 5 gal Pail  One 55 gal liquid drum   Drum labels: Use oil; Hazardous waste

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete the semi-annual hotspot inspection for the station Follow procedure 0500-0015 Analyze and download pictures Enter hotspot in Engage hotspot module Create Maximo for all hotspot above monitoring level Complete Datasplice job plan  Provide the Supervisor/Planner with the list of hotspots found
WORK_STEPS: Please make a request from the desk, to have the cap banks put in service 1 at a time to shoot the hotspots, the night before.  If no operator is present follow procedure 0300 - 0061.  Notify Supervision immediately if any equipment is discovered to have a Hot Spot that meets the Off on Emergency Category II (OOE2) qualification.  To enter new hotspots in Engage: Click on the New Hot Spot Entry Link (in attachments) Enter all required information Upload hotspot picture Click save -if a hotspot for the equipment already exist  -and the location is the same   -Click select to add new picture and temperature for hotspot -If hotspot is on same equipment but different location  -Click create new hotspot to save all data
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Infrared camera Computer with FLIR software

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)

Notify Supervision immediately if any equipment is discovered to have a Hot Spot that meets the Off on Emergency Category II (OOE2) qualification.  To enter new hotspots in Engage: Click on the New Hot Spot Entry Link (in attachments) Enter all required information Upload hotspot picture Click save -if a hotspot for the equipment already exist  -and the location is the same   -Click select to add new picture and temperature for hotspot -If hotspot is on same equipment but different location  -Click create new hotspot to save all data
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Infrared camera Computer with FLIR software

WORK_OBJECTIVES: High Voltage Test Set PM as per Procedure 0500-0012
WORK_STEPS: Perform Job Briefing Onsite & Ensure Safe Driving Recommended HPI TOOLS: Procedure Use & Adherence; Place Keeping; & Attention to Detail [SEE ATTACHED HPI TOOLBOX) Perform HVTS PM as per attached Procedure 0500-12 Complete Data splice Round Leave work-site clean.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Grounding Stick Mechanic As Toolbox
MATERIALS: no special material required

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform quarterly or semi-annual inspection  of battery per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WODESC: GRASSLANDS ANNUAL DIESEL GEN BATTERY INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries Perform a physical inspection Record battery charger float voltage Record battery charger float current Measure and enter ripple current Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Record room temperature Measure all cell/unit internal impedance Measure all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Upload cell voltage, impedance, and resistance readings Complete datasplice round, create cm work order as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Batteries and perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Gloves  Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda

WODESC: BRUCKNER (FULL/EMPTY) NITROGEN STORAGE UNITS HAVE EXCESSIVE CORRSION
GROUNDING OF FENCES AND GATES AT HELLGATE
DISC. 7N7A OPERATING MECHANISM SHIFTING DURING USE.
TR NO 1 TAP CHANGER HANG UP ALARM NOT WORKING (TRIED NEW BULBS STILL NG)
WASHINGTON ST DIESEL GEN FLOOR NEEDS PAINTING
REPAIR 13KV FIRE ALARM PANEL AS PER ESR 2019-19177 - SEE LONG DESCRIPTION
REPAIR TR N7 SPCC MOAT WALL-CRACKS/DETERIORATION PER ESR 2018-18867 SEE LONG DESCRIPTION
INSTALL PERMANENT POWER AND ALARM CABLE/CONDUIT FROM OIL MINDERS TO CONTROL ROOM SEE LONG DESCRIPTIO
WHEN DELUGE WAS ISOLATED TO TRANSFORMER 1, THE 'NOT FULLY OPEN' ALARM WAS NOT ACTIVE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a minor DT breaker pm for an ABB PM-63 Breaker Record SF6 pressure Perform SF6 gas testing, record results Perform visual inspection of breaker condition Perform check of cabinet heaters Perform check of cabinet door gaskets Inspect cabinet for leaks and corrosion Inspect Hydraulic system for leaks Perform check of oil level Report SF6 leak checks performed (if gas call in the last 5 years) Perform inspection of auxiliary switches and control relays Perform inspection of control wiring, linkage, indicators and lights Perform required cleaning Perform required lubrication Perform a micro ohm reading Perform timing tests  Record the as left counter reading Perform a final inspection of the Circuit Breaker Inform Supervisor of any readings out of spec. (Supervisor shall review such readings with Engineering) Complete datasheet, data splice round, and create cm work orders for discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform Minor DT as per procedure 0770-0001 Chem Lab is to test for the below (Instruction currently being updated): Moisture Content, Purity, SO2 Close timing - should be 50-85 (datasheet has to be updated) Open velocity - 13.4-15.7 (Instruction has to be updated)
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Manlift Micro Ohm Meter Fluke Timing Set SF6 Gas Sniffer Leak Tech Laser Camera Wiring Tools Hand Tools Ladders Tarps Rope
MATERIALS: Contact Grease Absorbent Pads Duct Tape Binding Wire Lint Free Cloth Rags Solvent

(Supervisor shall review such readings with Engineering) Complete datasheet, data splice round, and create cm work orders for discrepancies

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed

MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete compliance according to 500-0701
WORK_STEPS: Ensure Safe Driving****SECRUE LOADS ON RIG******  Perform Job Briefing Onsite Recommended HPI TOOLS: Procedure Use & Adherence; Place Keeping; & Attention to Detail [SEE ATTACHED HPI TOOLBOX)  ***ENSURE ELECTRICAL SAFETY*** Check Dead Prior to Touching any COPPER!!!! VERIFY PROTECTION !!!  ***If DG is found to be Unavailable for service for any reason during the PM Immediately NOTIFY the station operator and your Supervisor!!!  Review Procedure 0500-0701 Perform DG PM as per attached procedure ****PPE***While unit is running ensure hearing protection  Complete Data splice Round Create Drum Log in Data Splice  Complete request Drum Pick UP  Email request Drum Pickup to station supervisor/Local EHS Rep: Leave work-site clean  Report Status to Supervisor at end of shift
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Mechanics A tool box  HPI Tool Box  Strap wrench  Ear Protection
MATERIALS: Reference Exhibit A from 0500-0701 Sample Jars  Fuel Filter  Oil filters  Lubricants  Engine oil 15W40 Drain Pans  Two 5 gal Pail  One 55 gal liquid drum   Drum labels: Use oil; Hazardous waste

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform breaker pm for a Powervac Vacuum Circuit Breaker with ML18 Mechanism Perform visual inspection of breaker condition Perform inspection of breaker components (i.e. wiring, bolted connections) Perform inspection of Primary Disconnects Perform Spring Discharge Interlocking System Tests Slow close of Circuit Breaker Check Contact Wipe Check Contact Gap. Check Contact Erosion Perform electrical Checks of Stored Energy Operating Mechanism Perform Lubrication of breaker components Perform breaker cleaning Perform micro-ohm Perform Breaker Timing Tests Perform a vacuum integrity test Perform insulation resistance testing (open & closed positions) Check and record the counter reading Perform a final inspection of the circuit breaker For breaker cubicles, perform cubicle pm 0700-0706 Perform a visual inspection of breaker cubicle Perform cleaning of cubicle Perform lubrication of cubicle components Check compartment heater and thermostat Check compartment lighting and receptacles Complete data splice round and create cm work orders for discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform breaker/cubicle pm Follow Instruction 0700-0715 and 0700-0706 and ensure objectives are all completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • 2500 volt Meg-ohm-meter • Micro-Ohm Meter • Dielectric Proof Test Set (listed below or equivalent): • Hipotronics Model 860 Pl, 880 PL or 7BT60A Biddle, Cat. # 222060 • Non-metallic rule • Wiring tools • Barrier tape or equivalent barrier material / equipment • Masking tape • Feeler gage, 0.0015 – 0.200” • Dial caliper, 0.0 – 4.0” • Torque wrench, 1/2” drive, 0.0 – 175 ft-lb • 5/16” Allen wrench • 1/4" Square drive ratchet • 1/4” Square 3” extension • 7/16” Socket wrench • Square drive ratchet • 5/8” Socket wrench • 7/16”, 3/4", 15/16”, 1” and 1-1/8” Wrenches • Needle nose pliers • Slip joint pliers • Lint-free cloth • Reference wood block (2-7/8” x 6”)
MATERIALS: • All-In-One Lubrication Kit • Loctite # 271 or equivalent • Lubricant, grease, GE type 0282A2048P009 or equivalent • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per procedure 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per procedure 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE
