BRUCK TR 2 A-PHASE CT FAILURE - REPLACE CT
BRUCK TR 2 A-PHASE CT FAILURE - REPLACE CT
BREAKER CONTROL HANDLE NEEDS TO BE REPLACED
ALARM: BATTERY DISCHARGE OR BATTERY SWITCH OPEN
TEST AND REMOVE PACM WIRE OUTSIDE WEST YARD BATTERY ROOM
FIXED LADDERS ABOVE WEST YARD BATTERY ROOM NEED NEW CHAIN OR SWING GATE.
LOW OIL LEVEL FOR DIVERTER COMPARTMENT - ADD OIL AND CALIBRATE GAUGES
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Verify low oil condition Add oil to proper level
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE THAT JOB BRIEFING IS HELD ONSITE  ENSURE SAFE DRIVING  COMMUNICATE WITH STATION OPERATOR AND OBTAIN WP as required Recommended HPI Tools: ATTENTION TO DETAIL, Two Minute Rule, & Questioning Attitude {See attached HPI TOOLBOX for guidance}  LADDER SAFETY AND PROPER FALL PROTECTION! *Phase Angle Regulators and Reactors have sudden pressure relays (SPR's) that must be isolated prior to adjusting oil level.  *Visually inspect compartments for signs of oil leaks or oil migration, and determine the source of oil loss.  *Visually inspect transformer and verify that the oil level gauge/oil level indicator is at the low mark.  *Determine oil level by utilizing the Tygon tubing method as follows:      (1) Attach Tygon tubing to the compartment drain valve, and secure the tubing to a level above the oil.               (a) For nitrogen blanket units, disconnect the end of the nitrogen system to                     avoid over-pressurization when adding oil.               (b) For conservator units, enough clearance shall be present to raise the                     tubing above the level of the conservator and secure with proper                     clearances from all energized equipment. The end of the tubing shall run                     back to ground level and into a containment vessel.     (2) Open valves, and observe the level of oil in Tygon tubing.  *In order to avoid introducing air bubbles into the compartment, clean hoses shall be charged and bled of air prior to adding oil into the compartment.  *Determine oil temperature using the oil temperature gauges on the transformer or other suitable method of determining oil temperature such as an infrared thermometer, or by scrolling thru the Kelman online DGA Monitor LCD.  * For nitrogen blanketed compartments, prior to pumping oil, open vent so the compartment is not overpressurized.  *Pump oil at a low flow rate of 5 GPM or less into compartments through the conservator oil fill valve or alternatively, the top fill valve until the oil level reaches the appropriate level based on the oil temperature.   *Verify the gauge is responding as the level is being adjusted and reading the appropriate level or make repairs as required.  For additional information for adding oil to a LTC compartment, refer to applicable SSO Load Tap Changer Inspection and Maintenance (600 Series) Instructions.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Velcon Filter Pump 1" Oil Hoses and Fittings Aquacon Filters Tygon Tubing Oil Pads Ladder Fall Protection
MATERIALS: Clean, Dry Tested, Approved Oil (Shall meet or exceed those standards indicated in the criteria table 5 found in CS-ES-1003)

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Hold permit for vendor to perform work - YABOO TO INSTALL BARBED WIRE IN ATHENS YARD  Monitor vendors work and activities Complete contractor oversight form Complete datasplice round at end of job Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Ensure contractors sign in and are issued contractor id badges -Badges are kept by operators Perform job briefing at job site Review HASP with vendor and permit holder Monitor vendor activities and provide any coordination required Notify management of any safety incidents Complete contractor Field Observation Form (CFOR) for vendor -Click on link "Contractor Oversight System" in attachments -Click on CFOR -Click "Create"  -Change organization to "Substation Operations"  -If completing work for a different organization select from drop down -Click "Contractor Field Observation" and then submit  -Form should come up to complete  -Area management should provide PO for vendor Complete datasplice round on daily basis -answer is work complete "No" until last day of job and then change answer to "Yes"  Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
OTHER_GROUPS: Please ensure to add HASP to plan

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Quarterly/Semi-Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform quarterly or semi-annual inspection  of battery per instruction 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete compliance according to 500-0701
WORK_STEPS: Ensure Safe Driving****SECRUE LOADS ON RIG******  Perform Job Briefing Onsite Recommended HPI TOOLS: Procedure Use & Adherence; Place Keeping; & Attention to Detail [SEE ATTACHED HPI TOOLBOX)  ***ENSURE ELECTRICAL SAFETY*** Check Dead Prior to Touching any COPPER!!!! VERIFY PROTECTION !!!  ***If DG is found to be Unavailable for service for any reason during the PM Immediately NOTIFY the station operator and your Supervisor!!!  Review Procedure 0500-0701 Perform DG PM as per attached procedure ****PPE***While unit is running ensure hearing protection  Complete Data splice Round Create Drum Log in Data Splice  Complete request Drum Pick UP  Email request Drum Pickup to station supervisor/Local EHS Rep: Leave work-site clean  Report Status to Supervisor at end of shift

MATERIALS: Reference Exhibit A from 0500-0701 Sample Jars  Fuel Filter  Oil filters  Lubricants  Engine oil 15W40 Drain Pans  Two 5 gal Pail  One 55 gal liquid drum   Drum labels: Use oil; Hazardous waste

MATERIALS: Reference Exhibit A from 0500-0701 Sample Jars  Fuel Filter  Oil filters  Lubricants  Engine oil 15W40 Drain Pans  Two 5 gal Pail  One 55 gal liquid drum   Drum labels: Use oil; Hazardous waste

WODESC: N TRANSITION ANNUAL DIESEL GEN BATTERY INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries Perform a physical inspection Record battery charger float voltage Record battery charger float current Measure and enter ripple current Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Record room temperature Measure all cell/unit internal impedance Measure all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Upload cell voltage, impedance, and resistance readings Complete datasplice round, create cm work order as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Batteries and perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Gloves  Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Quarterly/Semi-Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform quarterly or semi-annual inspection  of battery per instruction 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform Distribution / Transmission  Compressor Routine Inspection Perform a visual inspection Check for leaks  Drain moisture from Air receiver tanks Perform a crankcase Oil Inspection Add oil if required Report any oil leaks found to EHS Control Desk Complete datasplice round, create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform Routine Compressor Inspection for Distribution & Transmission breakers  Review the latest version of 0500-0017 "Inspection and Maintenance Program for Compressed Air/Gas Systems / Instruction  For All Breakers perform the below: Perform visual inspection Check for evidence of air leak  -if suspicion of leak, perform leak check using leak detection spray -report any identified leaks to supervision Drain tanks - Check ambient temperature    -If less than 40 Deg. F, Do Not Drain tanks    -If above 40 Deg. F, drain tanks into containers with oil pads until only air comes out       Record how many gallons of water  Perform Crankcase Oil Inspection -Verify oil level in compressor -Replenish oil as necessary Note: Do not mix synthetic and non-synthetic oil, will cause damage to seals Record compressor running time  Record compressor low side operating pressure Record compressor high side operating pressure (if no high side , enter zero in Datasplice )  Check heaters If an SF6 breaker: Check gauges for pressure Complete datasplice round and create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Fluke meter Flashlight Thermometer
MATERIALS: Garbage bag 5 gallon bucket and or container with pads  Air Leak Detection Spray

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed

WODESC: ACADEMY STREET-PUMPHOUSE-PH M29 ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Quarterly/Semi-Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies

MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WODESC: DUN NO-PUMPHOUSE-PH1 ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per instruction 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant) Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_STEPS: ENSURE THAT JOB BRIEFING IS HELD ONSITE  ENSURE SAFE DRIVING  COMMUNICATE WITH STATION OPERATOR Recommended HPI Tools: ATTENTION TO DETAIL, Two Minute Rule, & Questioning Attitude {See attached HPI TOOLBOX for guidance}   1.  Print out datasplice round & review 2.  Perform Monthly Compliance 3.  Note all discrepancies & notify supervisor
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Hand Tools Gloves Ladders/Step Stools
MATERIALS: Zerust Vapor Capsules

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete compliance according to 500-0701
WORK_STEPS: Ensure Safe Driving****SECRUE LOADS ON RIG******  Perform Job Briefing Onsite Recommended HPI TOOLS: Procedure Use & Adherence; Place Keeping; & Attention to Detail [SEE ATTACHED HPI TOOLBOX)  ***ENSURE ELECTRICAL SAFETY*** Check Dead Prior to Touching any COPPER!!!! VERIFY PROTECTION !!!  ***If DG is found to be Unavailable for service for any reason during the PM Immediately NOTIFY the station operator and your Supervisor!!!  Review Procedure 0500-0701 Perform DG PM as per attached procedure ****PPE***While unit is running ensure hearing protection  Complete Data splice Round Create Drum Log in Data Splice  Complete request Drum Pick UP  Email request Drum Pickup to station supervisor/Local EHS Rep: Leave work-site clean  Report Status to Supervisor at end of shift
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Mechanics A tool box  HPI Tool Box  Strap wrench  Ear Protection
MATERIALS: Reference Exhibit A from 0500-0701 Sample Jars  Fuel Filter  Oil filters  Lubricants  Engine oil 15W40 Drain Pans  Two 5 gal Pail  One 55 gal liquid drum   Drum labels: Use oil; Hazardous waste

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform Distribution / Transmission  Compressor Routine Inspection Perform a visual inspection Check for leaks  Drain moisture from Air receiver tanks Perform a crankcase Oil Inspection Add oil if required Report any oil leaks found to EHS Control Desk Complete datasplice round, create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform Routine Compressor Inspection for Distribution & Transmission breakers  Review the latest version of 0500-0017 "Inspection and Maintenance Program for Compressed Air/Gas Systems / Instruction  For All Breakers perform the below: Perform visual inspection Check for evidence of air leak  -if suspicion of leak, perform leak check using leak detection spray -report any identified leaks to supervision Drain tanks - Check ambient temperature    -If less than 40 Deg. F, Do Not Drain tanks    -If above 40 Deg. F, drain tanks into containers with oil pads until only air comes out       Record how many gallons of water  Perform Crankcase Oil Inspection -Verify oil level in compressor -Replenish oil as necessary Note: Do not mix synthetic and non-synthetic oil, will cause damage to seals Record compressor running time  Record compressor low side operating pressure Record compressor high side operating pressure (if no high side , enter zero in Datasplice )  Check heaters If an SF6 breaker: Check gauges for pressure Complete datasplice round and create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Fluke meter Flashlight Thermometer
MATERIALS: Garbage bag 5 gallon bucket and or container with pads  Air Leak Detection Spray

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Electrical tape Wiring tools Assorted wrenches Digital multi-meter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.) HEPA vacuum (with electrically non-conducing nozzle/hose) Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform station visual inspection of all substation and cooling plant equipment Complete datasplice round and create cm work order Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: 1. Ensure you receive DOJT CSG0020 from the supervisor -Each time inspection is to be performed -Supervisor is to ensure it is reflect in the employees training record 2. Ensure datasplice round with site specific questions is provided 3. Proceed to follow the ppt 4. Complete the datasplice round  -Create CM work order for any discrepancies found 5. Inform the supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Clip board
MATERIALS: Writing pad pen

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Objective  Perform Stray Voltage Testing -Test for voltage on steel, aluminum, other electrical conducting materials in substations Inspect all perimeter fence and swing gates  -Ensure all are properly connected to ground via 4/0 cable -Perform easy repair such as    - reattaching a ground, tightening a connection point..etc.
WORK_STEPS: 1. Ensure you receive DOJT CSG0020 from the supervisor -Each time inspection is to be performed -Supervisor is to ensure it is reflect in the employees training record 2. Review section 5.4.9 in CE-ES-2002 Part 10 Substation Grounding 3. Review DRW 181895 for fence grounding specifications 4. Ensure datasplice round with station inspection points is provided 5. Proceed to follow the ppt and complete inspection 6. Complete the datasplice round  -Create CM work order for any discrepancies found 7. Inform the supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Stray Voltage Pen & tester Distance meter Fluke Meter Hand tools

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Take a picture of each one of the bushing nameplates (Bushings 69kV and up).  Once a picture of each nameplate is taken, the picture is to be sent to field equipment engineering to analyze and validate.   Equipment engineering will verify type of bushing and asset management to upload nameplate data into the MTL if information is not already in place. The information will then be gathered and retained in the MTL for Con Edison records.
WORK_STEPS: Have job briefing and discuss HPI tools  Set up ladder and maintain clearance from all energized equipment  Take a photo of each bushing nameplate and record bushing information for bushings 69kV and above. The photo must show the manufacturer and catalogue/model number and serial number of the bushing. Also record the information.  Upload photos for review and send to the following for validation  dl-maximoadmins@coned.com  SEField&Equipment@coned.com BRYANS@coned.com
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Ladder Ladder Belt Camera

WORK_OBJECTIVES: ***NOTE for CUMMINS DGs See attached Special Instructions*** Replace current batteries with Odyssey PC2250 batteries: Charge new batteries before installation for at least 20 hours Replace old batteries with new Odyssey PC2250 Take baseline readings for the below: Record battery charger float voltage Record battery charger float current Measure and enter ripple current Measure the battery terminal voltage Ensure inter-cell connectors are tight Record room temperature Measure all cell/unit internal impedance Measure all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Upload cell voltage, impedance, and resistance readings Ensure that the DG is test run by Operator to ensure the unit starts after the replacement is completed. Dispose of batteries via an authorized recycling vendor Complete datasplice round, create cm work order as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: ***NOTE for CUMMINS DGs See attached Special Instructions*** Remove old batteries Install with new batteries Follow steps from 0500-0022 to take baseline readings Ensure that the DG is test run by Operator to ensure the unit starts after the replacement is completed. Upload all data to MTL
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Insulated wiring tools Assorted insulated wrenches Digital voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc) Gloves  Battery Impedance Test Set
MATERIALS: 2 BATTERY CELLS - PC2250

WORK_OBJECTIVES: TROUBLESHOOT  ALARM CIRCUIT  Use the Adept system to verify latest version of prints Wear all PPE properly-FR clothing/Shirts tucked in HPI Tools are a must-self/peer check at all times Make sure you are in the right place at the right time "Stay in bounds" If you have ANY questions contact your supervisor immediately-Stop when unsure If the ticket is transferred to another mechanic perform a  detailed turnover & job briefing.
WORK_STEPS: Ensure a detailed job briefing is discussed with all team members - Protection/PPE/Hazards associated/Special Precautions/Instructions or Procedures/Applicable HPI tools Obtain Work permit-Fill out a detailed job briefing form  MANAGE & LIMIT DISTRACTIONS Stop, Think, Act & Review Use 2 minute rule whenever needed Trouble shoot the ground using traditional methods and the ground signature set Upon completion of the troubleshooting verify associated alarms are clear Return the work permit-Make sure it is signed  Report findings to supervisor and complete CM data splice round

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform an Annual maintenance on the Oil / Water separator. Notify SSO Control Center, ECC and AECC about test Inspect the control panels Barricade work area Check the operation the Leak Detector Check the operation of the Level Sensors Verify MOV closes on "High High Oil " alarm Isolate the OWS by closing the Inlet MOV Remove the  grade level cover over the Coalescer and the Petro Screen Filters Unbolt and remove the 18" manway from over Sediment  Perform a camera / visual inspection Inspect the OWS static level and sediment chamber, record findings on the "OWS Inspection Summary Form" If a high sediment level  is recorded, notify engineering Remove Barricades Record all required data on the Data Splice sheet Notify SSO Control Center, ECC and AECC that test is completed Report all irregularities to the Supervisor Create a CM in Maximo for all required maintenance that cannot be addressed at this time.
WORK_STEPS: Perform an Annual maintenance on the Oil / Water Separator Ensure all objectives are all completed The system description and Annual Maintenance Instructions are attached below, additional information may be found there. Fill in all required information on the "Inspection Summary Form" Upload all forms and data to the MTL Datasplice round will be created and added to job plan once instruction is approved

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a  PM on an S&C MARK V CIRCUIT SWITCHER Perform an Initial Inspection of the Circuit Switcher Record all required data  Perform a Mechanical Check of the Circuit Switcher Measure and Record the resistance at all required points Perform a Check of the Contact Timing Perform a Manual Operation of the Circuit Switcher Prepare the Circuit Switcher for Service Perform a Post Maintenance Inspection Record all required information on the Instructions and Data Splice Sheet Create a CM for all work not completed at this time
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE THAT JOB BRIEFING IS HELD ONSITE  ENSURE SAFE DRIVING  COMMUNICATE WITH STATION OPERATOR AND OBTAIN WP as required Recommended HPI Tools: ATTENTION TO DETAIL, Two Minute Rule, & Questioning Attitude {See attached HPI TOOLBOX for guidance}  Perform a PM on an S&C MARK V CIRCUIT SWITCHER Define the perimeter of the maintenance area with barrier tape Check for availability of replacement parts Record the following on the Data Sheet a. Station name, equipment position, and date b. Maximo Work Order number c. Why the Circuit Switcher is being inspected Ensure all required information is recorded on the Instruction and Data Splice sheets A link to Instruction 0700-1603 is included below
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • 1000-volt Megger • Barrier tape • Clamp-on meter • Cleaner/Degreaser • Chain Lubricant • Disconnect Switch contact lubricant – Shell Darina EP2, Dow Corning DC44, or equivalent. • Lift or scaffold • Lint Free Rags • Personal Protective Equipment • Replacement parts as necessary • Solvent, Precision NF or equivalent • Stop Watch • Timing set • Micro-ohm meter
MATERIALS: Insure all required spare parts are available: • Gasket for Shunt-Trip Solenoid-Housing cover • Gasket for Terminal Block cover

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Quarterly/Semi-Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform quarterly or semi-annual inspection  of battery per instruction 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Assorted insulated wrenches Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant)
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed

WODESC: P SEDGW-PURS PLANT-M51N ANNUAL HOT SPOT INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Assorted wrenches Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags Barrier tape Electrical tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: none
WORK_STEPS: ENSURE Job Briefing; PPE, & SAFE DRIVING Obtain Permission or Work Permit from Operator or Shift Manager (ensure station log entry if working in PURS without an Operator) Infra -Red Scan all live equipment in pump house, CP, or PURS including: pumps, motors, throw over switches, contactors, wires, breakers, relays, etc.   Record any hot spots and take regular pictures to match the thermal images, take several pictures for analysis if hotspots are noted Email Hot spot & regular photos to Planner & Supervisor with a description of equipment Ensure area is left neat and secured.
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flir Thermal Camera
MATERIALS: Paper & Pen for Note taking

WODESC: WHITE PLAINS ANNUAL DIESEL GEN BATTERY INSPECTION
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries Perform a physical inspection Record battery charger float voltage Record battery charger float current Measure and enter ripple current Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Record room temperature Measure all cell/unit internal impedance Measure all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Upload cell voltage, impedance, and resistance readings Complete datasplice round, create cm work order as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0022 Inspection and Servicing of Lead Acid Storage Batteries and perform an annual inspection on the diesel generator batteries
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Gloves
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform Distribution / Transmission  Compressor Routine Inspection Perform a visual inspection Check for leaks  Drain moisture from Air receiver tanks Perform a crankcase Oil Inspection Add oil if required Report any oil leaks found to EHS Control Desk Complete datasplice round, create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform Routine Compressor Inspection for Distribution & Transmission breakers  Review the latest version of 0500-0017 "Inspection and Maintenance Program for Compressed Air/Gas Systems / Instruction  For All Breakers perform the below: Perform visual inspection Check for evidence of air leak  -if suspicion of leak, perform leak check using leak detection spray -report any identified leaks to supervision Drain tanks - Check ambient temperature    -If less than 40 Deg. F, Do Not Drain tanks    -If above 40 Deg. F, drain tanks into containers with oil pads until only air comes out       Record how many gallons of water  Perform Crankcase Oil Inspection -Verify oil level in compressor -Replenish oil as necessary Note: Do not mix synthetic and non-synthetic oil, will cause damage to seals Record compressor running time  Record compressor low side operating pressure Record compressor high side operating pressure (if no high side , enter zero in Datasplice )  Check heaters If an SF6 breaker: Check gauges for pressure Complete datasplice round and create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Fluke meter Flashlight Thermometer
MATERIALS: Garbage bag 5 gallon bucket and or container with pads  Air Leak Detection Spray

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform Distribution / Transmission  Compressor Routine Inspection Perform a visual inspection Check for leaks  Drain moisture from Air receiver tanks Perform a crankcase Oil Inspection Add oil if required Report any oil leaks found to EHS Control Desk Complete datasplice round, create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies

TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Fluke meter Flashlight Thermometer
MATERIALS: Garbage bag 5 gallon bucket and or container with pads  Air Leak Detection Spray

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per instruction 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Assorted insulated wrenches Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant)
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Assorted wrenches Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags Barrier tape Electrical tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Follow instruction 0800-0029, including the following:  Plugs, Catch Basins and Manholes  If oil is present, call the Spill Desk  Check for debris  Remove cover over petro-barrier and inspect filter media Replace/washout media as required Trough Barriers Inspection must be performed by lifting trough covers on either side of the trough barrier  If oil is present, call Spill Desk Check for debris and replace/washout media as required For Sump Oil Water Filtration Inspection Follow provided instructions If oil is present, call Spill Desk Check for debris and replace/washout media as required Complete datasplice round  Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: PRECAUTIONS Confined Space procedure (Corporate Environmental, Health and Safety Procedure CEHSP S16.00, “Permit Required Confined Space Program) must be followed for any installation in a surveyed confined space. If unsure of space classification, contact your local EH&S representative. Wear all appropriate personal protective equipment. Site specific map to be added to job package
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Man hole hooks shovel broom 55 gallon wet/dry vacuum Leather Gloves Nitrate Gloves Fork lift
MATERIALS: Spare Petro Plugs Batting Filter Media Garbage Bags Vipor 100 SOWF 7x20 pre-filter sock(C2-E-00550)
OTHER_GROUPS: Add station SPCC Plan  CIAGENT POC (Vipor 100 SOWF) Dan Koons Regional Manager Secondary Containment & Coatings Mobile: 502-314-0319 DKoons@justrite.com>  www.ciagent.com

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform breaker PM of SIEMENS GMI Breaker per Maintenance Instruction 0700-1202  Perform visual inspection of breaker condition Inspect Manual Spring Discharge and Trip Interlocks Perform mechanical checks of the Mechanism Perform Electrical Checks of the Stored Energy Operator Mechanism Perform a Lubrication of Breaker components Perform a cleaning of the Circuit Breaker Perform required testing of breaker Perform a Final Inspection of the Circuit Breaker Perform Vacuum Integrity Test  For Breaker Cubicles, perform Cubicle Inspection per Maintenance Instruction 0700-0706 & 0700-1202 Perform a visual inspection of Breaker Cubicle Perform cleaning of Cubicle Perform lubrication of Cubicle components Check compartment heater and thermostat Check compartment lighting and receptacles Complete data splice round and create cm work orders for discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform breaker pm and cubicle pm (if applicable) as per instructions 0700-1202 and 0700-0706, ensure objectives are all completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: • Micro-ohm meter • Multimeter • Breaker Timing Equipment • Metric tools (for use on Interrupters) • Standard tools (sockets, wrenches etc. for all other parts) • Wiring tools • Lint-free cloth • Test umbilical cord • Barrier tape • Appropriate PPE (face shield, goggles etc) • Drift pins: 1/8”, 3/16” and ¼” diameter • Flashlight • Vacuum cleaner
MATERIALS: • All-in-One Lubrication Kit • Lubricant, grease, GE type 0282A2048P009 or equivalent • Alcohol (denatured or isopropyl, Solvents, Precision NF or equivalent • Lint-free cloth • Scotch Brite

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform functionality Inspection on ABB PM-63 breaker Inspect control cabinet Check breaker hydraulic fluid level Report any hydraulic leaks observed Check cabinet thermostat  Check cabinet heaters  Record breaker counter operations Inspect breaker porcelains Complete datasplice round, create cm work order for any discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies found
WORK_STEPS: Use attachment "ABB PM-63" to perform inspection Inspect control cabinet -Check for abnormal conditions -Check cabinet light -Check for signs of water intrusion -Check for signs of animal/rodent entry (droppings, chewed wires) -Clean out any unnecessary objects may have been left in cabinet - Check all Compression fittings for tightness   Check breaker hydraulic fluid level -Sight glass should be at least half full  Inspect breaker porcelains -Check for cracks -Check for chips -Check for excessive dirt
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Flash light
MATERIALS: pen/paper

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Quarterly/Semi-Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform quarterly or semi-annual inspection  of battery per instruction 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Assorted insulated wrenches Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant)
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket Barrier tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Assorted wrenches Clamp-on AC ammeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: L40 wipes Rags Barrier tape Electrical tape

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform inspection per instruction 0500-0022 Perform all steps for Annual Inspection Perform Physical inspection Check Electrolyte levels Record Battery charger float voltage Record Battery charger float current Check Battery room ventilation Measure the battery terminal voltage Check for loose or corroded inter-cell connectors Measure individual cell specific gravity Record battery room temperature Record temperature of 25% of the battery cells Visually inspect the internal condition of each cell jar Clean the jars Using a Battery Impedance Test Set, measure all Cell/Unit internal impedance Check the flame arrestors for cleanliness Take and record all cell to cell and cell to terminal connection resistances Check and record Strap Resistance with D.L.R.O. meter As per N.P.C.C. directory 8, verify that the Battery String holds load after 10 min. of being unplugged from the rectifier. Perform this test only for N.P.C.C batteries Perform Equalizing Charge as needed Upload battery data Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform annual battery inspection per instruction 0500-0022
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Barrier tape Hydrometer (long barrel type) Hydrometer (short barrel type) Thermometer (for Excide type of cells) Excide Series Connector Bolt Package Face shield Goggles Apron (acid resistant) Gloves (acid resistant)
MATERIALS: Bicarbonate of soda Distilled water Lint-free Rags Absorbent Pillows Gallon Bucket

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a visual inspection of meters, switches and controls for damage Perform a sensory (audible, smell and visual) inspection of the station rectifier interior  -Check for overheated, failed or leaking components Perform a light cleaning with an industrial type vacuum cleaner -If annual inspection   -Perform a thorough cleaning of each diode and rectifier with an industrial type vacuum cleaner   -Perform a replacement of all air filters Air filters, when supplied with the equipment should be cleaned during every inspection Perform an “as found” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” measured float voltage reading at the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” float voltage reading on the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” float voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” float current reading from the rectifier meter Perform an “as found” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as found” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the float voltage adjustment Record the equalize voltage adjustment Perform an “as left” float voltage measurement at the battery bank Perform an “as left” float current measurement from the rectifier meter Perform an “as left” equalize voltage reading at the battery bank Perform an “as left” equalize current reading from the rectifier meter Record the AC ripple current, in mA. If repairs or replacements are required, refer to maintenance instruction for proper battery isolation procedures.
WORK_STEPS: Follow procedure for rectifier inspection -If the associate battery is due for an annual inspection, the rectifier annual inspection/cleaning is to also be completed

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Complete the semi-annual hotspot inspection for the station Follow procedure 0500-0015 Analyze and download pictures Enter hotspot in Engage hotspot module Create Maximo for all hotspot above monitoring level Complete Datasplice job plan  Provide the Supervisor/Planner with the list of hotspots found
WORK_STEPS: Please make a request from the desk, to have the cap banks put in service 1 at a time to shoot the hotspots, the night before.  If no operator is present follow procedure 0300 - 0061.  Notify Supervision immediately if any equipment is discovered to have a Hot Spot that meets the Off on Emergency Category II (OOE2) qualification.  To enter new hotspots in Engage: Click on the New Hot Spot Entry Link (in attachments) Enter all required information Upload hotspot picture Click save -if a hotspot for the equipment already exist  -and the location is the same   -Click select to add new picture and temperature for hotspot -If hotspot is on same equipment but different location  -Click create new hotspot to save all data
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Infrared camera Computer with FLIR software

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Load Board Data Sheet and in the Work Management System. Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC

MATERIALS: Proper PPE

Record the following "As Found" rectifier conditions: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present DC alarm status (Local and Control Center). Open the rectifier DC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. Close the rectifier DC switch. Open the rectifier AC switch. Record the following: Rectifier voltmeter reading Rectifier ammeter reading Battery ammeter reading Battery ammeter deflection/polarity (positive/negative) Load Board ammeter reading, if present Record which alarm, if any, is initiated. If the above test is successful, restore the rectifier to service. Perform Ground Detector Tests. Perform Ground Tests.
WORK_STEPS: Follow instruction 0500-0025  All load board data shall be recorded in all applicable columns on the DC
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: DC Load Board Test Form 2,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 6,000 ohms-10 watt resistor wire, fully insulated 10 feet of #14 AWG rubber coated wire 2 - 20 amp hooded clips High impedance DC voltmeter (Fluke, Amprobe, etc.)
MATERIALS: Proper PPE

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform a minor compressor inspection as per Ins. 0500-0017 Perform visual inspection Perform air leak check, as needed Check oil levels  Check for evidence of oil leakage Check air intake pad  Check compressor drive belt Check cabinet heaters Inspect compressor enclosure  Inspect WAHL Temp-Plate Strips  Ensure feed is restored Drain air receiver tank Record water quantity drained Record compressor run time Record operating pressure Record operating temperatures Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform a minor compressor inspection as per Ins.  0500-0017 Perform visual inspection Perform air leak check, as needed Check oil levels  Check for evidence of oil leakage Check air intake pad  Check compressor drive belt and adjust/replace as needed Check cabinet heaters Inspect compressor enclosure for cleanliness and evidence of rodent intrusion Inspect WAHL Temp-Plate Strips & install/replace as needed Ensure feed is restored Drain air receiver tank -if temperature is below 40 deg. F, DO NOT DRAIN TANK! Record water quantity drained Record compressor run time Record operating pressure Record operating temperatures Complete datasplice round Create cm work order for any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Fluke meter Flashlight Thermometer
MATERIALS: WAHL Temp-Plate Strips

WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform Distribution / Transmission  Compressor Routine Inspection Perform a visual inspection Check for leaks  Drain moisture from Air receiver tanks Perform a crankcase Oil Inspection Add oil if required Report any oil leaks found to EHS Control Desk Complete datasplice round, create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Perform Routine Compressor Inspection for Distribution & Transmission breakers  Review the latest version of 0500-0017 "Inspection and Maintenance Program for Compressed Air/Gas Systems / Instruction  For All Breakers perform the below: Perform visual inspection Check for evidence of air leak  -if suspicion of leak, perform leak check using leak detection spray -report any identified leaks to supervision Drain tanks - Check ambient temperature    -If less than 40 Deg. F, Do Not Drain tanks    -If above 40 Deg. F, drain tanks into containers with oil pads until only air comes out       Record how many gallons of water  Perform Crankcase Oil Inspection -Verify oil level in compressor -Replenish oil as necessary Note: Do not mix synthetic and non-synthetic oil, will cause damage to seals Record compressor running time  Record compressor low side operating pressure Record compressor high side operating pressure (if no high side , enter zero in Datasplice )  Check heaters If an SF6 breaker: Check gauges for pressure Complete datasplice round and create cm work orders as required Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: mechanic tools Fluke meter Flashlight Thermometer
MATERIALS: Garbage bag 5 gallon bucket and or container with pads  Air Leak Detection Spray

WODESC: REA 2N1 COLLECTION TANK FLOAT LEVEL SW PR8 INSP
WORK_OBJECTIVES: Perform OWS ANNUAL FLOAT LEVEL SW TEST LS-1  Record high level set point Record low level set point Complete datasplice alarm, create cm work order for any discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
WORK_STEPS: Remove the level switch assembly from the carrier pipe sleeve, exposing the three floats Lay the assembly in the horizontal position, supported so that the floats can be moved freely Place the three floats in the "up" (normal operating position) Turn on circuit breaker CCB1 in both control panels.  At each level switch assembly  -Move each level switch float to the "down" position to actuate each switch at each required point (1) The OWS high oil level amber light turns "on" when the middle float is moved down to rest on its bottom collar, and "off" when the float is returned to rest on its upper collar (2) The OWS high-high oil level red light turns "on" on the local MOV control panel when the bottom float is moved down to rest on its bottom collar, and "off" when the float is returned to rest on its upper collar (3) The OWS low water level amber light turns "on" when the top float is moved down to rest on its bottom collar, and "off" when the float touches its upper collar. The associated control panel audible/visual alarm will actuate when any one of the float switches is activated (in the down position) If the level switch floats do not slide/operate smoothly and freely on the stem, clean the float and stem with a clean cloth and repeat the steps 1, 2, Observe associated indicating lights at the corresponding local control panel -Confirm that each float switch activates the corresponding indicating light on the respective control panels  -Ensure audible/visual general alarms actuate Reinsert floats in the carrier pipe sleeves and properly reinstall Once float assemblies have been tested Ensure are panels are reset Ensure ows inlet and outlet valves are open Complete datasplice round, create cm work order for any discrepancies Inform supervisor of any discrepancies
TOOLS_EQUIPMENT: Tape measure Manhole Hooks
